NYU's Administration is committed to providing faculty, research staff and administrative support staff with the tools necessary to perform the various research administration functions required to ensure the responsible stewardship of extramural funds.     Partnerships between central support units, including Sponsored Programs Accounting & the Office of Sponsored Programs, the Contracts Office, and others to assess the needs of our campus, develop and deliver training workshops, on-line tutorials, and other opportunities for professional development.   Check out our site often, as it is a work in progress that we expect will continue to evolve in response to the changing environment within which NYU research administrators operate.        Research Administration Training         Training in Research Administration Certificate (TRAC) Program   Responsible Conduct of Research   Office of Veterinary Resources   Human Subjects Tutorial   Controller's Division Training     Research Training Resources     Office of Sponsored Programs Training Materials   NIH Webinar     NCURA YouTube Channel     Responsible Conduct of Research Resources          Resources     The following are links to sites which contain helpful information as it relates to Pre-Award proposal development, as well as links to professional organizations through which you can connect with your research administration collegues across the country.   Links and References     Center for Scientific Review "What Happens to Your Grant Application: A Primer for New Applicants"   "Inside the NIH Grant Review Process" video   Advice to Investigators Submitting Clinical Research Applications   Academic Scientists Toolkit   NYU ITS Research Computing Website     Research Administration Professional Organizations       National Council of University Research Administrators (NCURA)   Society for Research Administrators (SRA)                                              Conflict of Interest        Required Training                                                             Inquiries about trainings? Please fill out Ask ITS Contact form to submit questions or feedback. Be sure to select "NYU Classes" as the Subject.     related pages            NYU Blackboard information        NYU Teaching and Learning Resources       NYU Classes Training and Support site       NYU Classes support in the ServiceLink knowledge base                     New walk-in support clinics now available    Walk-in support clinics are now available to assist you in the use of NYU Web Publishing and NYU Classes. The clinics are offered every Monday from 2-4pm at Bobst Library, room 509; no need to make an appointment! See below for additional support options.      Online training modules   Self-paced, online training modules for faculty, students and staff are available via the NYU Classes Training and Support site .     Weekly walk-in support clinics   The NYU Classes service team now offers support clinics available in Bobst Library (70 Washington Square South) every Monday from 2-4pm in room 509. Drop by for in-person help from the Web Publishing team; no need to make an appointment!    Individual and small group consultations   Looking for individualized help for yourself or a small group of your colleagues? In addition to the above walk-in support clinics, one-on-one and small group consultations can be scheduled with the NYU Classes support team. Click here to schedule a time .    Training contact   If you would like to send a special training request or learn more about training options, please send email to nyu-classes-training-group@nyu.edu for assistance.    Other ITS training   To view other ITS training offerings, visit the ITS Training Page ( www.nyu.edu/its/training ).    Page last reviewed: January 23, 2015
